docs.snippet: "Kobe Bryant might be traded, and he might not," writes Will Leitch in this week's Play newsletter. "He'll tell reporters he wants to be traded, then he'll back off, then he'll post a message to his Web site, then he'll recant it hours later. None...
docs.lead_paragraph: "Kobe Bryant might be traded, and he might not," writes Will Leitch in this week's Play newsletter. "He'll tell reporters he wants to be traded, then he'll back off, then he'll post a message to his Web site, then he'll recant it hours later. None of it means anything. Currently in Google, 'Kobe Bryant Championship' brings up 702,000 hits; 'Kobe Bryant trade' brings up 926,000. This will be his legacy, and ours."

docs.abstract: Its been a frantic few weeks. As the world now knows, Google and partners have unveiled the OpenSocial API. It shows promise as a strong competitor to Facebook and something I am very excited about.It was also an opportunity to develop and play with social gadgets in Mountain View over the course of two days prior to public release. From the number of developers and ideas floating around its clear that early on people saw the clear potential - and this was before it was known that other partners were involved.
